Package com.univpm.oop.WeatherPal.model.Statistics

Interface Distribution

All Known Implementing Classes:
AirPollution
public interface Distribution
Interfaces implemented by the classes of which, if collected in a vector, can be calculated average, variance and standard deviation. It has implemented static methods to calculate average, variance and standard deviation from a vector whose elements' class implements this interface. It has also methods to do the same calculations from a simple vector of something that extends Number.

  • Method Details

    • simpleAvg

      static double simpleAvg(Vector<? extends Number> array)
      Parameters:
      array - : vector of Number or subclasses
      Returns:
      the average of array's elements, as a double value with 4 decimal places.

    • simpleVar

      Returns:
      the variance of array's elements, as a double value with 4 decimal places.

    • simpleStdDev

      static double simpleStdDev(Vector<? extends Number> array)

      Returns:
      the standard deviation of array's elements, as a double value with 4 decimal places.

    • complexAvg

      static <E> HashMap<String,Object> complexAvg(Vector<? extends Distribution> array)
      Method that creates an average representation of all the objects contained in array and returns it as an hashmap. This hashmap has the same tree node structure of the class of array's elements: each key is an attribute name, the corresponding value is the average of that attribute's values in the elements of array.

      The difference with an object of the reference class is that the hasmap returned has all double values, even those who were integers. Not numerical fields of the reference class (e.g. strings) are not present in the hashmap.

      Parameters:
      array - : a vector of objects that implement Distribution interface
      Returns:
      a hashmap that represents the average of all the objects contained in array.

    • complexVar

      static <E> HashMap<String,Object> complexVar(Vector<? extends Distribution> array)
      Method that creates a 'variance representation' of all the objects contained in array and returns it as an hashmap. This hashmap has the same tree node structure of the class of array's elements: each key is an attribute name, the corresponding value is the variance of that attribute's values in the elements of array.

      The difference with an object of the reference class is that the hasmap returned has all double values, even those who were integers. Not numerical fields of the reference class (e.g. strings) are not present in the hashmap.

      Parameters:
      array - : a vector of objects that implement Distribution interface
      Returns:
      a hashmap that represents the variance of all the objects contained in array.

    • complexStdDev

      static <E> HashMap<String,Object> complexStdDev(Vector<? extends Distribution> array)
      Method that creates a 'standard deviation representation' of all the objects contained in array and returns it as an hashmap. This hashmap has the same tree node structure of the class of array's elements: each key is an attribute name, the corresponding value is the standard deviation of that attribute's values in the elements of array.

      The difference with an object of the reference class is that the hasmap returned has all double values, even those who were integers. Not numerical fields of the reference class (e.g. strings) are not present in the hashmap.

      Parameters:
      array - : a vector of objects that implement Distribution interface
      Returns:
      a hashmap that represents the standard deviation of all the objects contained in array.
